description: From hexa- +‎ -pod, from Ancient Greek ἑξαποδ- (hexapod-), oblique stem of ἑξάπους (hexápous, “six-footed”), from ἑξα- (hexa-, “six”) +‎ πούς (poús, “foot”).

entries.meaning: Having six feet, six-footed; belonging to the subphylum Hexapoda; hexapodous.
Any organism, being or robot with six legs.
examples: These concepts are applied to a robotic hexapod, which, through the use of compliant microspines on its feet, is capable of climbing hard vertical textured surfaces, such as stucco

entries.meaning: An arthropod with six feet; a member of subphylum Hexapoda.
